definition: an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
one side/other/different/lateral component of a Chinese character (such as 刂[dao1], 亻[ren2] etc)
Taoist monastery/palace gate watchtower/platform
surname Guan
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
pinyin: dang1 ju2 zhe3 mi2 , pang2 guan1 zhe3 qing1

sentences.english: People say "the outsider see the best of the game. " Will you please make a comment on the fair?
sentences.chinese: 人們都說“旁觀者清”，請您對交易會作個評價好嗎？

sentences.english: Is it doubtful that the onlooker sees most of the game ?
sentences.chinese: 旁觀者清，這一點還有什麼可疑的嗎？

definition: lit. find a stage, put on a comedy (idiom); to join in the fun/to play along according to local conditions
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
the person involved/the people holding power
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
traitor to one's love/heartless rat
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
spilt water is difficult to retrieve (idiom)/it's no use crying over spilt milk/what's done is done and can't be reversed/the damage is done/once divorced, there's no reuniting
to bring trouble on oneself (idiom)
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
idle gossip
